subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Tuesday, 03 July, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Blades lose appeal on relegation
Sheffield United's bid to regain Premier League status looks to be over after an arbitration panel rejects an appeal for West Ham to lose points.



 
HM Revenue to challenge Leeds Utd
Ken Bates' proposed buyback of Leeds United is to be challenged by HM Revenue & Customs, the BBC learns.



 
Ranieri rules out Lampard signing
Juventus manager Claudio Ranieri is not planning a summer move for Chelsea midfielder Frank Lampard.








GOLF




Cash boost for 2007 Open champion
The winner of this year's Open at Carnoustie will pocket £750,000, an increase of £30,000 on last year.



 
Asian Tour anger at Korea event
The Asian Tour accuses its
European counterpart of trying to "colonise" the continent after announcing a new event in South Korea.



 
McDowell wins at Open qualifying
Northern Ireland's Graeme McDowell comes out on top of the controversial 36-hole Open qualifying at Sunningdale.








MOTORSPORT




I can overhaul Hamilton - Alonso
Fernando Alonso is adamant he can catch McLaren team-mate Lewis Hamilton's in the race for the Formula One drivers' championship.



 
Ferrari sack key man after probe
Ferrari sack their head of performance development Nigel Stepney following an internal investigation.



 
Button backed to match Hamilton
Honda are confident of giving Jenson Button a car to compete with McLaren star Lewis Hamilton.








FORMULA ONE




I can overhaul Hamilton - Alonso
Fernando Alonso is adamant he can catch McLaren team-mate Lewis Hamilton's in the race for the Formula One drivers' championship.



 
Ferrari sack key man after probe
Ferrari sack their head of performance development Nigel Stepney following an internal investigation.



 
Button backed to match Hamilton
Honda are confident of giving Jenson Button a car to compete with McLaren star Lewis Hamilton.








ATHLETICS




Devonish edged out in Athens 100m
Britain's Marlon Devonish comes second behind Derrick Atkins of the Bahamas in the men's 100m at the Athens Grand Prix.



 
Pavey qualifies for World Champs
Britain's Jo Pavey qualifies for the World Championships after beating the 10,000 metres qualifying time in Watford.



 
Super Weir claims two world bests
Wheelchair racer David Weir sets two new world records in the 1500 and 5,000m in Atlanta.








CYCLING




Di Luca doping hearing postponed
The anti-doping hearings of Giro winner Danilo di Luca and his Italian compatriot Eddy Mazzoleni are postponed.



 
Thousands tackle 'Le Tour' route
Up to 5,000 riders are cycling the Tour de France route through London and Kent.



 
Brit Cavendish claims Tour spot
Britain's Mark Cavendish is named in T-Mobile's nine-man team for the Tour de France.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Freddie Flintoff is likened to a toddler and the stars hit out at Wimbledon



 
Strawberries and screams
Robbo suggests 'Hawk-ear' to calm Sharapova down



 
Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport
